00026 namespace isis

00035 namespace _internal
00036 {
00038 template<typename TYPE> struct __cast_to {
00039     template<typename SOURCE> TYPE operator()( Value<TYPE>*, const SOURCE &value ) {
00040         return boost::lexical_cast<TYPE>( value ); //generic version types are different - so do lexical cast
00041     }
00042     TYPE operator()( Value<TYPE>*, const TYPE &value ) {
00043         return value; //special version types are same - so just return the value
00044     }
00045 };
00046 template<> struct __cast_to<uint8_t> { // we cannot lexical_cast to uint8_t - we'll get "characters" (1 => '1' == 49)
00047     template<typename SOURCE> uint8_t operator()( Value<uint8_t>*, const SOURCE &value ) {
00048         // lexical cast to unsigned short
00049         const unsigned short val = boost::lexical_cast<unsigned short>( value );
00050 
00051         // have to check by hand because the lexical cast will only check against unsigned short
00052         if( val > std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max() ) {
00053             throw boost::bad_lexical_cast( typeid( SOURCE ), typeid( uint8_t ) );
00054         }
00055 
00056         // and then static_cast to uint8_t
00057         return static_cast<uint8_t>( val );
00058     }
00059     uint8_t operator()( Value<uint8_t> *, const uint8_t &value ) {
00060         return value; //special version types are same - so just return the value
00061     }
00062 };
00064 
00065 /*
00066  * This is the mostly abstract base class for all scalar values (see types.hpp).
00067  * Additionally, there's the ValuePtrBase containing the more complex data handling stuff with abstract values.
00068  * Both are derived from GenericValue containing the description of the actual value type.
00069  */
00070 
00071 class ValueBase : public GenericValue
00072 {
00073     static const ValueConverterMap &converters();
00074     friend class ValueReference<ValueBase>;
00075 protected:
00082     virtual ValueBase *clone()const = 0;
00083 public:
00084     typedef ValueReference<ValueBase> Reference;
00085     typedef ValueConverterMap::mapped_type::mapped_type Converter;
00086 
00087     template<typename T> bool is()const;
00088 
00089     const Converter &getConverterTo( unsigned short ID )const;
00090 
00099     static bool convert( const ValueBase &from, ValueBase &to );
00100 
00115     template<class T> T as()const {
00116         if( is<T>() )
00117             return castTo<T>();
00118 
00119         Reference ret = copyByID( Value<T>::staticID );
00120 
00121         if ( ret.isEmpty() ) {
00122             LOG( Debug, error )
00123                     << "Interpretation of " << toString( true ) << " as " << Value<T>::staticName()
00124                     << " failed. Returning " << Value<T>().toString() << ".";
00125             return T();
00126         } else
00127             return ret->castTo<T>();
00128     }
00129 
00136     template<typename T> const Value<T>& castToType() const;
00137 
00144     template<typename T> const T &castTo() const;
00145 
00152     template<typename T> Value<T>& castToType();
00153 
00160     template<typename T> T &castTo();
00161 
00163     virtual bool operator==( const ValueBase &second )const = 0;
00164 
00166     Reference copyByID( unsigned short ID ) const;
00167 
00172     bool fitsInto( unsigned short ID ) const;
00173 
00174     virtual ~ValueBase();
00175 
00176     virtual bool gt( const _internal::ValueBase &ref )const = 0;
00177     virtual bool lt( const _internal::ValueBase &ref )const = 0;
00178     virtual bool eq( const _internal::ValueBase &ref )const = 0;
00179 };
00180 
00181 }
00182 
00183 typedef _internal::ValueBase::Reference ValueReference;

00186 }
